bullet_points: Produce 5 course ideas with working titles and 3–5 module bullets each, explicitly naming the ChatGPT tools/features to be covered (e.g., Advanced Data Analysis, Browsing with citations, File uploads/retrieval, Vision, DALL·E, Custom GPTs with knowledge and no-code actions, Memory, structured outputs/templates, multi-step workflows, Teams/Enterprise privacy/sharing).

For each idea include: (a) explicit module-level time estimates with hands-on lab time so the 24-hour scope is verifiable, (b) a lab requirements list with exact sample files and required access level (Free/Plus/Enterprise), (c) one concrete capstone concept with success criteria, (d) 3 exemplar prompts or template outputs suitable for non-coders.
Deliverables and filenames: /deliverables/step01_ideas.md and /deliverables/step01_lab-needs.csv.
Handoff protocol: Upload deliverables to the folder above and list filenames at end of ideas.md. Next-step agent (idea_hater) must confirm receipt and accept or request one revision within 48 hours.
Acceptance checks (QA):
- Includes module-by-module time and lab time per idea; totals align to 24 hours.
- lab-needs.csv lists exact sample files and access level per lab (Free/Plus/Enterprise).
- Each idea has a concrete capstone with success criteria and 3 exemplar prompts/templates.
Time budget: 6 hours.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Generate 5 distinct course ideas tightly aligned to the topic, audience, and 24-hour duration

bullet_points: Provide pros/cons per idea focusing on pedagogical soundness, 24-hour feasibility, cross-industry fit for non-coders, technical depth, hands-on adequacy, and privacy/compliance considerations (Plus vs Teams/Enterprise).

Produce a scored rubric (CSV) with columns: idea_id, pedagogical_soundness, feasibility_time, industry_fit, technical_depth, hands_on_adequacy, privacy_risk, overall_notes, prioritized_fix (one-sentence remediation).
Highlight any developer-only content and specify how to make it non-technical.
Deliverables and filenames: /deliverables/step02_critique.csv and /deliverables/step02_critique-memo.pdf.
Handoff protocol: Upload deliverables; notify next-step agent (idea_maker). Next-step agent must confirm receipt and accept or request one revision within 48 hours.
Acceptance checks (QA):
- critique.csv includes all required scored columns and one prioritized fix per idea.
- critique-memo.pdf summarizes pros/cons and flags dev-only content with concrete conversion guidance.
- Explicitly references access differences (Plus vs Teams/Enterprise) and privacy/compliance risks.

sub_tasks.sub_task: Critique the 5 ideas for pedagogy, feasibility, and audience fit with a structured, machine-readable rubric

Create capstone assessment rubrics (JSON) with pass/fail benchmarks; ensure non-coder accessibility and 24-hour feasibility.
Produce a precise assets request list for the engineer with filenames, formats, sizes for all needed lab files, DALL·E prompt pack items, Custom GPT manifests, and no-code connector example(s).

Handoff protocol: Upload deliverables; notify next-step agent (engineer). Next-step agent must confirm receipt and accept or request one revision within 48 hours.

- Selection justification cites specific scores from step02_critique.csv.
- Module outlines include explicit tool coverage and per-module learning outcomes.
- capstone_rubrics.json contains clear pass/fail benchmarks tied to the tools/features used.

sub_tasks.sub_task: Select and improve the top 2 ideas based on critiques; prepare assets request for engineer
